direction.raw_text: : White. pristine, empty frame.   Clean and peaceful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's gentle motion in the blank frame, like swirling 16mm grain. A RUMBLE starts to build, low but growing louder... The grain moves faster, big chunks fluttering, now a dirty dishwater grey. The RUMBLE becoming a HOWLING WIND. Churning black water LAPS at the bottom of the frame...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Heaven is a place where nothing ever happens.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A blizzard, at the peak of its power. Visibility zero, New York reduced to the hulking shapes of buildings on the banks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thrashes in the water, a long way from shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chunks of ice float in the dirty water around him. Max's body freezing, skin turning blue. Heavy winter clothes saturating, like an anchor dragging him down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max's face sinks below the surface...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There's an army of bodies under this river. Criminals, people who ran out of time, out of friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The next time they drag this river, they'll find me on the bottom with the rest of them. And there won't be anybody left to say I was different.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nothing to orient us to the location, the time. Just a flash of golden light filling the hall, warm as the river was cold. Around a closed door, sunlight streams through the gaps...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sleeps on the bed, curled up around a bundled BABY. Is this the final, peaceful memory of a drowning man? Something's wrong, then: the woman's body in an unnatural position, more thrown than laid across the bed. The crib tipped over, blankets scattered. Her eyes frozen open. Something BLACK flutters against the window pane, CRACKING into the glass. The sound of the BLIZZARD creeps in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - HUDSON RIVER Wind POUNDS the river where Max had once been, but there's no more thrashing in the water. Mixed in behind the falling snowflakes, BLACK SHAPES swirl and dive closer to the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max breaks the surface - GASPING, STRUGGLING against the undertow. Not simply trying to breathe...trying to swim.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I could feel the dead down there, just below my feet. Reaching up to welcome me as one of their own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was an easy mistake to make.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Abruptly, the snow is gone. Just a bitter wind left in its place, whipping through desolate streets long after midnight. Shuffling up the littered sidewalk, three rough-looking MEN duck out of the wind by descending down to the subway... On the dark side of the street, a pair of BOOTS follows them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :      ONE WEEK EARLIER INT. ROSCOE ST. STATION - DAY A filthy platform, empty except for the three Men huddled on a bench. A squeaking TURNSTILE catches their ear... The same boots grind towards the Men. We don't see the walker's face, distracted by something else: a gleaming gold wristwatch. As if to make certain the Men notice, he pulls back his sleeve to check the time. Quarter past three... The watch glints as it passes into a dark doorway marked `MEN'S.' The Men follow, exchanging wicked grins. Too easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Men slink into the bathroom, smirking at their oblivious prey at the sink. Steam rising, he sets the watch on the edge of the sink before washing his hands...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer. One of the Men LOCKS the door.       At the sound of the lock SNAPPING, he raises his head... Max Payne, but not yet the man struggling for life in the river: clean-shaven, skin like bleached bone. Haunted eyes. In the murky mirror, Max sees the Men circling closer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max shuts off the water and calmly turns to face them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug frowns, deeply confused about being called by his name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While Doug digests that, PAWNSHOP pulls a pistol and trains it on Max's forehead. The third man - not much more than a
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: #1 Hey, that's a really nice watch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 (drooling over the watch) Kinda reminds me of one I lost--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't lose it. You pawned it up on
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: th a few hours ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding to Man #2) Ask Doug. He was there with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've been following us all night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. (pointing) I'm only following you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: visibly frightened - backs towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Distractedly eyeballing Max, Doug brushes the watch off of the sink. It hits the dirty tile, delicate crystal CRACKING. In a sudden blur of movement, Max has one hand on the pistol, the other one SMASHING into Pawnshop's windpipe... Doug steps forward to help... BOOM! The pistol goes off as Max pries it free. Max looks up at Doug. Nowhere to run, he races into the farthest stall and SLAMS the door. In the same instant, the Kid bolts for the door. Max has to pick: follow or stay with the man he's tracking... In the stall, Doug crawls on his stomach across the sticky floor, trying to squeeze under the divider. Max raises the pistol and BLASTS a hole through the door of the next stall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The newly-perforated door flies open. Handcuffs SNAP, restraining a WHIMPERING Doug to the toilet pipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug finds himself staring at the pistol's front sight. Max reaches into his pocket and produces a tattered photograph... It's the woman from Max's golden vision in the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug shakes his head violently, confusion and terror rising.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sighing, Max unlocks Doug from the pipe, hauling him up and slamming into the wall as he cuffs his hands behind his back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You a cop, or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Too bad. (to Doug) Go get my watch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (craving, eyes closed) Watch over me, watch over me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Open your eyes, now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you ever seen her before?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got busted robbing a house in New Jersey with William Preston three--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bill's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's why I'm talking to you. (moving the photo closer) Did he ever say anything about this woman? Did you ever hear anyone--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bill died because their wings couldn't lift him up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, he got shot robbing a liquor store. What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (incoherent, rambling) Their wings are golden, the feathers only look black...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Max stalks out of the bathroom, pushing Doug ahead of him. Down on the tracks, the Kid shrinks into the shadows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid runs down the dark tracks, nervously glancing back at the receding light of the platform.   He slows gradually, relaxing as escape seems certain. Down to a walk, he startles at movement in the tunnel ahead:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - a bird, lost and trapped underground? The Kid freezes, his frightened BREATHS almost enough to drown the sound out. It grows, though, more WINGS joining... He turns to retreat up the tracks, but the WINGS suddenly seem to be echoing towards him from all directions. Panicked, the Kid becomes disoriented in the growing RACKET, the tunnel ahead begins to glow brighter as he spins... Visible now in the growing light, BLACK SHAPES flicker above the tracks - dozens becoming hundreds, swelling larger, their
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wings joined by a train RUMBLING closer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Frozen, the Kid can only squint into the headlights closing in, petrified by the dark wings SWIRLING around him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COLD CASE OFFICE - DAY The front room of the cold case department is a mess - desks piled high with paperwork and a week's worth of coffee cups. Halfway in the front door, a young DETECTIVE stands holding a box of his belongings. He looks around for signs of life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wanders down the hall, frowning at the draft.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS You my new guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't think anybody was here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS Everybody's usually a little late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sgt. Adams leads the detective down a hall, giving the tour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Sergeant continues towards the center of the building, farther from the light of the windows. He stops at a door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS All the cold investigations in the city are collected and delivered over to us. We call each witness to see if they can add anything to their original statement.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if they can?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS We send the file back to the original precinct for follow-up. Don't get your hopes up, though.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS Once you've gone through the file and come up empty, bring it here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They enter a windowless cave, long rows of metal cabinets stretching on forever into the heart of the building. At a desk in the corner, Max slumps over a stack of files.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ax looks up, dark circles from his long night in the subway. He nods, but the Detective is too busy making a note to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: iscretely, Max slides his cut-up knuckles under the desk...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Detective turns to Max, embarrassed after his reprimand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max smiles and nods, but his eyes give him away as a liar:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS Max here handles our filing. Once it hits his desk, a case is officially dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if there's no phone number for a witness? Should I follow up in person?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS Nope, we don't do that down here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand, then how--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS How do you solve that unsolvable murder mystery and redeem yourself?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The grand jury couldn't find--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS Stop. Trust me, there's a tragic story behind why I'm here giving you this tour. We all did something, so just save it. (moving for the door) Follow me to the break room...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We should get a beer after work, or something...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.   Maybe so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Detective steals a look at Max as Adams shuts his door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So what did he do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Naturally, this reaction piques the detective's curiosity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The detective nods.     Adams glances through the window at Max.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS (sharply) Nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS R emember when you were a kid, and you'd hold your breath when you went past a graveyard?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ADAMS ust...try to leave him alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Max sneaks a sideways glance to the door, watching Adams lead the new Detective away. Once they're gone, Max reaches into his desk and removes a file... `PRESTON, WILLIAM A.' ax goes to a rusted cabinet and buries the file deep inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lock POPS.     Max steps inside, only silence to greet him. Max lays his jacket across the back of a worn leather chair, footsteps REVERBERATING because there's little other furniture to absorb the sound. He keeps walking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...past a table with one chair, past gleaming counters. Max fills a glass of water from the tap. Eyes blank, patient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carefully, Max rests the full glass on the arm of the chair. Reaching underneath the chair, Max produces an artist's sketchbook and places it delicately on the table before him. Sith trembling hands, Max turns back the battered cover... uddenly, colors burst into the monochrome room: bright swirls of oil pastels sketch out a still life in Technicolor. Gradually, Max's eyes lose their hardness. His breaths come
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ragged. Jaw clenched, he turns the page...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More flowing brush strokes, the artist's feminine initials... Max reaches up to turn the page, hands shaking severely... He takes hold of the corner of the page, but his muscles won't cooperate - as if the page ways more than Max can lift. Max's skin flushes red...tears almost welling... And then at once, Max slams the book shut and turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T The door swings open. Hanging inside, the battered coat we saw Max wear in the subway. A pistol on a hook by the door. Urban armor, scarred by countless nights of service. Max dresses himself for battle, eyes returning to stone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max climbs out of the subway into a neighborhood with a foot in two worlds: the buildings are old and crumbling, but the shops inside are sleek and expensive. A jarring combination. M ax walks up the street, brushing past HOMELESS PEOPLE and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jostling for the same space on the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . APARTMENT BUILDING - HALLWAY The hallway is ancient brick, but the doors are pristine steel. Pausing at one with a dozen locks, Max KNOCKS. The door cracks.    An EYE appears.   Squinting, evaluating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door cracks enough to reveal the speaker: TREVOR, skinny- fat in an sharp suit and sunglasses, shirt open a little far.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) You can't come here anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: William Preston was a dead end.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't come here, I said. I'm done helping you. I've already... (lowering his voice) ...paid my debt to society, you know? I've cooperated enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We need to talk.   Won't take long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - ENTRANCE HALL Max follows Trevor inside. The narrow brick entry opens into a cutting-edge loft beyond, filled with modern art and a gathering of BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE milling around enjoying it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the guests catches Max's eye: NATASHA, young and beautiful, returns his gaze for an extra moment and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trevor stands his ground, not flinching at Max's threat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max nods, fatigue fighting the determination in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you found Bill's partner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did, but Doug only wanted to talk about pigeons, or something. I need a new name, someone robbing houses to feed a habit around that same time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three years is a lifetime for guys like that. One way or the other, they're probably all gone now. (a little self-satisfied) Either way, I'm not the one to ask anymore. I cater to a better class, now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can see that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is a party. These are my friends. You remember friends?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need another name, or I start frisking your friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: don't have one to give you, Max. Look, you've gone through all your living leads, now you're running out of dead ones... (beat) I don't think this guy's out there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ry sleeping at night every now and then, you'd see that for yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Max doesn't answer. His eyes have drifted back to Natasha. She plucks a drink from a passing tray, revealing a dark smudge across the inside of her wrist as she does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly intent, Max pushes past Trevor and into the loft.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'd invite you in, but...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: hanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CONTINUOUS Max weaves through the party towards Natasha, out of place in his utilitarian clothes. She looks up as he gets closer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She speaks with a Russian accent - smiling, a little nervous. Rather than answering, Max's eyes drop to her wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ax takes her hand, gently turning it to reveal her tattoo: a black wing, stylized feathers tracing faint blue veins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max follows her gaze to the front door, where Trevor is nervously greeting another new arrival: MONA SAX. She's striking, beautiful but also a little frightening. It doesn't hurt that she's flanked by BODYGUARDS. Russian Mob. Seeing Natasha standing with Max, Mona barrels across the room towards them. People stand aside to let her pass. ithout preamble, Mona begins YELLING at Natasha in Russian. Natasha RESPONDS in kind, clearly intimidated by Mona. Abruptly, Mona grabs Natasha's arm, jerking her off balance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ou decided to stay for a while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ow it's your turn to say something...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's interesting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you. It's... (glancing past Max) Shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you let go--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mona returns to Natasha, dragging her towards the door. Natasha's tone becomes PLEADING, physically no match for Mona. Max steps in, reaching up to touch Mona's shoulder... I t happens in a flash: Mona spins and takes hold of Max's arm. Incredibly, he's just as fast, slipping free of the grip that would surely have snapped his wrist... For a moment, Max and Mona stare each other down. Surprised, reevaluating each other. Natasha continues to TALK, her Russian anxious as Mona's bodyguards push through the crowd. Mona's eyes drop to Max's chest, where the tussle pulled his coat open to reveal a low-pro holster and tarnished badge. With the flick of her wrist, Mona stops her guards' advance. The crowd begins to notice the altercation. Natasha keeps
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in perfect English) Mind your business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: trying desperately to make peace and reassure Mona of something. Mona's eyes cut between Natasha and Max... till apprehensive, Mona shakes her head and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Max nods at the understatement, Trevor rushes over, forcing a broad smile to reassure his guests. He pulls Max's coat closed over the badge and ushers him towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max turns to the spot where Natasha had been.   She's gone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My sister. (beat) Sort of a bitch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have to go. Now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pulling free) Fine. I just want to ask her something first...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The party has grown more crowded. Max fights his way down a dark hall, searching the shadowed faces he passes. Back here, the music is nothing but GROWLING BASS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A flickering glow escapes the gaps around one door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ring of candles in the center of the floor provides the only light. It's not enough to really see the PEOPLE inside. We hear them CHANTING, low voices MURMURING in unison... Quick glimpses in the candle light, bare flesh writhing. Cast on the walls, corresponding shadows twist and shift... A black feather billows across the floor between candles. Spreading up the wall, a new shadow rises above the rest... pair of wings - long and distorted in the candle light. Max appears in the doorway as the shadows loose their shape - Max only catching a glimpse, not sure what he's seeing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Max strains to see detail in the dark room, a face materializes in the haze: cheeks laced with tattoos, eyes twinkling flames sunk in deep shadow. JACK LUPINO. uddenly, Max turns and sees Natasha standing beside him.     We immediately notice something different about her: staring boldly into Max's eyes, all her earlier shyness vanished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natasha glances through the door at the shifting shadows, smiling at what she sees. Max follows her eyes...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Looking for me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Were you in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugging, coy) Take me somewhere, I'll tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Max leads Natasha inside. Before he can even shut the door, Natasha pounces - kissing, hands running over his body. As he pushes back, Natasha's hands slip into Max's pockets... Abruptly, Natasha breaks away and looks around the apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really interested, Natasha walks deeper into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In response, Natasha unbuckles her pants and lets them drop. Still walking, opening her shirt on her way out of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You just move in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: hree years ago. So we're somewhere, now: who was that guy--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Max moves down the hallway, following a trail of clothing. From inside a room, we hear the faint sound of CHANTING...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Max's bed, a thin sheet barely covers Natasha's body. Her lips tremble with a slurred SONG. With predatory eyes, she watches Max stop in the doorway, something holding him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caught off guard, Max tries to figure out how much he'll say. Natasha resumes CHANTING as she waits - a stream of frantic
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (frustrated sigh) Fine. What was her name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The girl from the boring story you want tell me. The one that ends with you living here. Very sad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rattling off, nothing recognizable as words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natasha grins, legs spreading, sheet starting to fall away...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: tell you what... (beat, evil smile) Call me by her name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (startled) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That way you can make love to her again, just like she never left you. (shrill, mocking voice) Oh, Max, I miss you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Like a switch, Max's face closes off again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natasha explodes out of the bed, springing up naked in front of Max - shoulders heaving with rage, eyes wild black holes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a moment, it seems like Natasha is about to attack.    Not physically intimidated, Max stares at her in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natasha stomps into the hall, gathering her clothes. She pulls a cell phone from her crumpled pants and dials...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max watches her disappear down the hall, front door SLAMMING a moment later. He looks around, silence returning again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You should go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exhausted, to himself) There's nothing you can tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ou're kicking me out of your bed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on phone) Owen, pick up if you're awake...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Natasha walks down a dark, desolate block, the sound of her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: echoing off of the crumbling buildings around her. Her eyes are still wild, her stride quick and aggressive. A group of MEN huddle in a stairway to avoid the wind. As Natasha passes, they look up at her with equally wild eyes. atasha steps off the sidewalk and into an alley, plunging into the darkness like she's been there many times before. In the distance, faint MUSIC rumbles through the street. moment later, the few working lamps on the street dim...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natasha barrels down the alley, squinting to see ahead.        The music is a little louder, BASS shaking the dumpsters. A wind picks up, garbage blowing... Suddenly unsettled by something, Natasha's pace slows.      She tenses, all her swagger vanishing before our eyes... can RATTLES in the alley behind her.    Natasha spins... Nothing - just the FLICKERING of moths swarming the alley's only light, their shadows black shapes against the bricks. The sound of much larger BEATING WINGS fills the alley... Eyes wide with terror, Natasha searches for something in the shapes cast by the moths, dread deepening as she finds it: eal winged shapes mix with the shadows, FLAPPING wildly... Natasha CRIES OUT, stumbling back.      She turns, running...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natasha's SCREAMS seem lost in the chaos of wind and WINGS and distant MUSIC. She suddenly stops running... More SHADOWS assemble ahead of her, their black wings open.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ot yet!   Please, just let me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Max hurriedly dresses, wearing the same suit from yesterday. He picks up his keys, searching around for something else - feeling the pockets of his jacket, down in the cushions...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max moves up the sidewalk, nearly at the steps of his office. A rough-running ENGINE idles up the street, getting closer. Slowly, Max realizes that he's being followed. He turns...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits behind the wheel - about Max's age, but in much rougher condition, everything about him a little ashen. He watches Max turn away from the office and move closer. Max returns Alex's stare. We don't know if they're about to smile or open fire. They don't seem to know, either. Alex slides over and throws the passenger side door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex and Max ride in silence, a palpable tension in the car. lex pulls a pack of cigarettes from his pocket and shakes one out. He holds the pack out to Max, who shakes his head. Alex nods, smiling, using his lighter and then laying it with the pack within Max's reach. Max doesn't even glance down. After a silent moment, Alex looks over at Max and frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shaking his head in disbelief, Alex pulls to the curb. T hey've parked at a crime scene - the alley in front of them sealed with police tape, COPS posted to keep onlookers away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex pulls a flask from under his seat, taking a quick pull.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're not serious, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need you to look at something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Alex approaches the alley, pulling on a leather jacket and snapping a badge onto his belt. The cops let him pass. Max follows Alex, slowing as he crosses the police tape. direction.raw_text: Max and Mona rush into the room, breath smoking from the cold. All of the windows are open. Gusts of snow blow inside, drifts of white powder extending into the room...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He SCREAMS his response from the next room.    They rush...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling out) Owen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ...through the door, weapons drawn.    Both stop short:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is all alone in the room. SCREAMING, swatting at empty air around him, each limb moving a different direction. M ax lowers his pistol - ready for anything, not for this. Owen's feet slip over the snow, toes curling desperately on the ice, searching for traction as they slide closer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...to an open window on the other side of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He doesn't seem to hear - sweat streams down his terrified face, snowflakes frosting the perspiration on his chest. Owen's eyes are instead drawn through the open windows... ..where SILHOUETTES flicker against the storm-darkened sky. Oblivious to the shapes outside, Max and Mona watch Owen's terror intensify, his dervish dance growing more frantic... Outside every window, BLACK SHAPES float closer in the air above the street - vaguely human, long wings POUNDING... ...sending gusts of wind ripping through the windows, kicking up snow and ice. Max and Mona shrink back, shielding their eyes at the blast as Owen's tortured SCREAMS fill the room... Twisting like he's trying to pull free from invisible hands, Owen reaches the window. As if trying to push back, his hands and feet fly up to the trim around the window...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unable to turn around, Owen's eyes find the reflected images of Max and Mona in the window he's being pulled to... H is attention is torn from their reflections on top of the glass by the spectres looming beyond it outside. Their claws reach in, raking his body, pulling him closer... Realizing that Owen isn't stopping, Max rushes towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max lunges forward, trying in vain to cover yards... ...when Owen only has inches.    He's ripped into the void...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (breathless, to no one) Help me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Owen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Owen, wait...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming) Make them stop, tell them I can't fly...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Max throws himself forward into the window, looking down... ...where Owen falls, looking up at Max helplessly... ... then less terrified, as the wind keeps RUSHING past... ...and then, just before impact, relieved. Owen CRASHES into the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mona races up to join Max in the window. For a stunned beat they look down at the shattered body of Owen Green - his unblinking eyes frozen on the heavens, collecting snowflakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer, Max studies Owen's twisted body. Long, finger- like bruises trace out from his neck, blending with the tattoos that lace his grey skin. Grinning skulls, the USMC eagle/globe/anchor... ...and a pair of wings, just like Natasha's.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (shaken) What did we just see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TATTOO PARLOR - NIGHT Max drops a Polaroid of Owen's tattoo onto a glass counter. lue water ripples through translucent pipes in the walls and floor, the air of the small room glowing like the ocean. A mirrored ceiling repeats the tattoo parlor again above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An elderly TATTOO ARTIST moves up behind the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max slides the photograph across to the Tattoo Artist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Artist stoops closer, tensing when he sees the design. Mona leans over the counter, locking onto the Artist's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As encouragement, Mona lets her coat open to reveal her gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: T he Artist goes to a shelf bulging with old books - his reference library. He searches through dusty volumes... Just past the shelves, a doorway is cracked open. A young
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're sure this is the place?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Natasha had all her work done here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something I can help you with?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if I wanted this tattoo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then you're probably in the Marine Corps.

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing to the wings) This one.

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (intimidated) It's a Norse superstition. The Vikings used to wear them for protection.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trust me, my sister had all the guardian angels she needed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not angels. Valkyries.

direction.raw_text: artist hovers in the dark and listens in on the conversation unnoticed - sweating, his pupils drawing back... Returning with a book, the Artist finds the page: a winged woman led by a pack of wolves over a grizzly battlefield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nodding, Mona lets her gun drift away from the Artist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mona turns to leave, satisfied, but Max is stuck on the book - the valkyrie's empty eyes, bloody bodies at her feet...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In Norse mythology, the only way you get to go to heaven is to die in violence. Die in your sleep, you go to hell. Valkyries fly over the battlefields, picking out the righteous dead. They reward the people who draw first blood. (beat) A soldier's angel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm generally thrilled to have referral business, but I tell people looking for those wings to find ink closer to home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some club down in Alphabet City.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Protection from what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . (2) Suddenly, all the lights go out. T he pipes stop glowing, blackness replacing the blue lights. Out of the corner of his eye, Max sees a DARKER SHADOW race across the room towards them, almost too fast to be human... Max and Mona have time to duck; the Artist isn't so lucky. A CRACK of bone, the old man's skull taking the brutal force... Mona's weapon BARKS, a short burst RIPPING through the air. n the momentary fire, Max can see the Shape swinging a club. The bat CUTS through the air, SMASHING open glass pipes in the wall behind Max, the shards raining down over him... The Figure charges at Max again.   Max's pistol CRACKS. The room is abruptly silent. The lights flash on.   Mona steps out of the back room... Max is stunned to find himself standing over nothing more monstrous than the Apprentice - one hand over the hole in his chest, the other weakly swinging a shard of glass at Max.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max shakes his head, struck mute by the look in the dying man's eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (gurgling, to Max) They see you...they see you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know this guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Max pushes the car over slick streets, clothes covered in the Artist's blood. Lost in thought, Mona looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (without conviction) Maybe it isn't anything new.   People get strung out, act crazy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think they were both on something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ax nods his agreement, replaying Owen's death in his mind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Crystal meth, maybe, some amphetamine that raises your body temperature in an overdose. Explains why they were both sweating like that, trying to cool off. (beat) Of course, a junky won't usually jump out the window if there's someone left in the room to beg or rob.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were standing right beside me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jumped is not the word I'd use.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In a block of abandoned storefronts, only one retains a spark of life, its red sign burning in the dying light: RAGNA ROK. T he streets are more crowded there, people shuffling towards that sign and the sounds of DARK MUSIC filtering from inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max's car turns onto the block, slowly approaching Ragna Rok. Max and Mona silently absorb the scene on the street. Even from halfway down the block, BASS from the club reaches them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Across the street, Max watches someone dragging a limp body by one leg. Nobody he walks past seems to notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max keeps his speed slow, idling away up the block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ragna Rok recedes in the mirror, the block between it and the car studded with more smoldering cars and dead-eye faces, their numbers seeming to grow even as Mona watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max doesn't answer, the coming plague before him registering. Mona glances up at a passing street sign - "LITTLE ITALY."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mona opens her car door and climbs out, leaning back inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mona SLAMS the door and moves off down the sidewalk, blending into the crowd. Max drops the car into gear, giving one last glance to Ragna Rok before pulling away. T here's some flicker of movement on the rooftop...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They all look...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like Owen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This isn't anything I've seen before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You ever been to Rome?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Better cities than this one have fallen. (pointing to the curb) This is far enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry about the chain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . RAGNA ROK - ROOFTOP - DUSK p on the roof, MUSIC inside the club RATTLES old pipes. Perched at the edge of the roof, a figure CHANTS along... Jack Lupino - the tattooed face we caught   a glimpse of in the candle light of Trevor's party, now fully   visible in the failing sun and no less frightening. His    colorless eyes absorb the street, the SCREAMS, Max's car   pulling away... On his back, the tattoos of two elaborate black wings. Steam rises from ink-blackened skin, snow melting before it lands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max sits in his chair in the silent room, turning the pages of Michelle's book. There's more than grief on his cut and bruised face tonight, hands not trembling the way they were. Fruit bowls, delicate charcoal nudes flip past... Frustrated, Max lets the images drift by with less sentiment: images no longer speaking to the questions he needs answered. With an exasperated sigh, Max slams the book closed... A faint white sliver appears in the cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Max leans closer. It's the corner of a piece of paper, protruding from a razor-thin cut in the spine of the sketchbook, invisible under all but the closest inspection. Max runs his thumbnail into the gap, spreading glue CRACKLING - he flinches, almost afraid to cause the book pain. F or a moment, Max is caught between his desire to protect the memento and to see what's hidden inside. A deep breath... With a sharp pull, the cover of the book SHEARS away. The pages wad and wrinkle, old paint flaking off. The cover he'd caressed RIPS. Fluttering to the floor, a sheaf of yellowed pages hidden in the cover flutter to the floor. Max opens the folded pages. The first is nearly identical to what we saw inside: a bouquet of flowers, unfinished. Max scrutinizes the pencil strokes...suddenly, his eyes go wide: A little pair of bat-like wings. In the corner of the page, having nothing to do with the rest of the still life. Max turns to the next page. There's a another drawing of wings - larger this time, pencil strokes more energetic. Horrified by what he's seeing, Max's hands tremble as they turn the page. On the next, the wings are the main drawing. On the next, they're scrawled in smeared ink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wings begin to lose their shape, overlapping. Growing together. The last page is completely black.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (nauseous, to himself) No...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Even with everybody out of uniform, the builds and body language mark this as a cop bar. BB rushes inside, hair giving him away as having been asleep shortly before. he bar is still decorated with plastic mistletoe and fake snow. BB looks at the BARTENDER, who motions to the back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fights his way to a corner booth, where Max is slumped over a beer and a shot. A matching set wait for BB across the table. BB pulls off his coat and sits, forced casual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: B            could only happen in here. B stoops down to find Max's eyes, trying for a connection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a long beat, Max works up the nerve to speak.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It was sitting at this very table that your father told me I needed to retire. (beat) For about a minute, I just sat here thinking about knocking him out of his chair. The job was everything to me, to the point that I couldn't see the writing on the wall - what it was doing to my marriage, my health. Your old man knew if I was going to listen to reason, it
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing you can't say in here. It's like hallowed ground.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I watched a guy throw himself out of a window tonight. The things he was saying-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any guy who throws himself out a window, I wouldn't pay any attention to the things he said.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The problem is, I knew what he was talking about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: tries to nod his understanding, but concern creeps in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: B goes a bit pale, smile fading as Max's words continue. B It's really important that you be careful how you talk to people about this, okay? You're already under suspicion--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ax stands up, storming towards the exit. BB pulls out a thick money clip and overpays before following...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't been really afraid of anything since...that night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you are now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's something going on, and I can't find a rational explanation for it. (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's...something out there, hurting people--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, calm down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's real.     I'm not crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then stop acting like it. Max, you're breaking into offices, I.A. is all over you, you won't even show up for work...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The night Alex died, there was something else in the room with us. I saw it. B
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's the same thing these people are seeing right before they die. (beat, pained) I think Michelle saw it, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For God's sake, don't drag her into this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rushes out, struggling to keep up with Max's longer legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max nods, but keeps moving away from BB.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max crosses against the light, cutting through the driving snow. BB tries to follow, but traffic pushes him back. H elpless, BB can only bury his hands in his pockets and watch Max fade away. After a moment, he pulls something out... A business card: `J. BRAVURA, I.A.'
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's really going on here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alex found something out about what happened to her. Something new. B There's no way.    He would have told us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was trying, right before he died... (
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, okay? Why don't you come back with me, let Beth make up the guest room for you. Just for tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You need to take some time. Get some sleep, heal up. See if it still feels real after that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's real.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In a ticket booth, an elderly ATTENDANT shivers by a space heater, ticket windows plugged with make-shift insulation. The attendant looks up from his book and sees Max approaching through the snow. Max slows as he gets closer, looking up at the glowing threshold to the trains beyond. He stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max holds for a moment. For all the danger he's faced, this is the most hesitation we've seen from him so far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max takes a step into the light of the ticket booth. The attendant opens the ticket slot, letting a gust of freezing air blow inside. Max slides a few bills through. Ticket in hand, Max starts his solitary march to the trains. (
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (via intercom) You riding?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: via intercom) If you're coming, you better come on. Way it's looking, might be the last train tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A dingy, dark bar on the first floor of an even sleazier hotel. It's nearly empty, only the dedicated DRUNKS venturing out in the storm. The front door swings open... The old men shiver at the stiff blast of wind rushing in, turning to look. Napkins flutter. Snowflakes blow inside. From a booth in the corner, VINNIE GOGNITTI (50s, pudgy) shoots a hard look at the open door, not immediately recognizing the SILHOUETTE in the passage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mona steps inside, boots heavy with ice. Her MEN follow. Flanked by MEN of his own, Vinnie freezes when he sees Mona.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gradually, Vinnie and his men relax.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In or out, asshole.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We need to talk. (beat) Talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut the door, then. You Ruskies may be used to it, but I'm freezing my dick off over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They've packed into a tiny back office - Russian gunmen on one side of the desk, Italians on the other. Mona and Vinnie represent their different sides, the only people seated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mona looks Vinnie over, bored to death by the whole thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: innie tries to keep a poker face, but the name chills him.

direction.raw_text: Mona frowns, her wishes granted a little too easily.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.     So talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something was taken from me. It involves a club in Italian territory, so I need your blessing to go make it right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're asking my permission? smirking to his men) Well in that case, sweetheart...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said `blessing.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. Well, blessing might cost extra. Which club are we talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ragna Rok.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Over on Avenue--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I know. (beat, rattled) Sure, fine. You have my permission...blessing, whatever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do still control that block, right? It's south of--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The guy's name is Jack Lupino.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, that sounds Italian to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's no kind of Italian I've ever seen. Tattooed freak, a real sicko from what we hear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sneering) You're afraid of tattoos, now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When the club first opened, I sent somebody down to collect the...you know, fire insurance. A day goes by, and I don't see him. Then I get two boxes delivered to me. One box's got my guy's hands and ears in it. The other box has a quarter of a million dollars in cash.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This neighborhood has been your family's forever. Two-fifty large is all it takes to--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What got my attention, Mona, was that the boxes were delivered by a cop car. A guy in uniform hands them to me in broad daylight. (beat) I'm not scared of tattoos, or freaks, or mouthy Russian bitches. But whoever's watching over Lupino, whoever it is you really need to bless you walking inside Ragna Rok...him, I am scared of.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The platform is cleaner than the ones in the city - dressed up for the tastes of the COMMUTERS who step off of the train. Max threads his way through the handful of exhausted
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: arriving home, moving out into the darkness.

direction.raw_text: The snow's driving just as hard out here, but peaceful houses with warm windows glowing make the storm feel comforting. In the yards, forgotten sleds disappear under new powder, gone for good by morning. Snowmen distort as they swell. Max Payne trudges up the center of the street, a black streak spoiling the peace of the evening. A trespasser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One house on the block stands out: there's no neatly shoveled driveway, no colorful Christmas lights flashing from the eaves. A black void behind every window, no life inside. ax stands in the street, looking up at the house.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) She was thirty-five. The daughter, two months. From what we could tell, it started out as a robbery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE - BACK YARD A row of footprints lead around back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanging in the overgrown hedges, an overlooked scrap of yellow police tape shimmers in the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max stands at the back door. He touches the unpainted wood around the glass, repairs never fully complete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max reaches for the handle...hesitant to actually touch...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) oth of the men had records, mostly bullshit - possession, petty theft.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ut that day...I don't know. They had something else on their minds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ax was maybe ten minutes late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A living room in the stillness of evening, golden air packed like amber around baby bottles and toys on the coffee table. The front door opens, and a man steps inside... Max Payne, different in every way: the malnourishment and neglect gone from his face, a fullness in his frame from M regular home-cooked meals. Shave and a haircut. Nice suit. ax picks up the mail from the floor and strolls inside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tie loosened, Max gets a beer from the fridge. Unwinding, he takes a long sip and begins sorting through the mail. lancing up from the mail, Max sees the kitchen door... Glass smashed.    Blinds torn.   Standing open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max charges upstairs.    MEN'S VOICES echo down from above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes aren't hard yet. Rushing up the stairs, we see Max's faith in the world start to crack for the first time... (
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling out) Michelle!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CONTINUOUS Max turns the corner into a hallway bathed in golden afternoon light, the same one he saw in the river... Between Max and the end of the hall, two JUNKIES are huddled against a door. Twisting the handle, SMACKING the wood. Max pulls a pistol from a low-pro holster, stepping forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Junkies turn to Max, eyes black and glassy.    Sick smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without a word, the Junkies charge. Max takes aim and BLASTS one of them in the forehead. The M other keeps rushing, swinging a long knife at Max's neck. ax ducks, a quarter-second and a quarter-inch from a slit throat. The swing throws the thin man off balance... He tries again - ropy muscles straining skin speckled with tracks. Max grabs his arm, throwing the thin man off balance. They go down to the hardwood floor together. Too close to line up a shot, Max drives the butt of the pistol into the man's nose, SPLITTING it across the bridge. Blood spatters his gaunt face, but those eyes never change...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Straining, he moves the knife's tip closer to Max's belly... Max jams the barrel under the Junkie's leering jaw and PULLS THE TRIGGER. Blood atomizes into a hanging cloud around him. Max jumps up and races to the door.    Locked from the inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max throws his shoulder into the door, SNAPPING the hinges...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling out) Michelle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: shouting to the door) Michelle, I'm right here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay.     They're angels, now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calling, frantic) Michelle!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CONTINUOUS The momentum sends Max tumbling inside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slips out of the window, one leg still inside... ax OPENS FIRE at the retreating shape. Curtains billow in front of the open window, a summer sunset outside. Max lets the gun fall to his side, breathing hard. M ichelle huddles on the bed, baby wrapped tight in her arms. Max rushes over to her, reaching out to touch her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her mouth is wide open, eyes unfocused.    Muscles slack. Michelle's not stunned.    She's not unconscious. he baby isn't just sleeping. The moment that hits him, the lights go out of Max's eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Michelle...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Max stands at the door, seeing the room with those same eyes. The furniture is gone, all the carpet ripped out. One window is still open, no frilly curtains blocking the blackness outside. Snow gusts in, piling on the sill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly marching across the room, Max SLAMS the window shut.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) We looked everywhere for the third guy, but there was nothing to go on. Not a hair of him left behind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stands in the window, watching the storm. B I called in a favor before I retired, had him transferred to Cold Case while he dealt with the shock of it. I thought it we were patient, gave him time, Max would come back to his old self again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bravura sits in front of the desk, watching BB. When BB finally looks over, the weight of the story showing in his eyes, Bravura's face B doesn't reveal any hint of emotion. B Look, I called you because I thought I recognized something in you. I thought if we could talk off the record--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not expecting this turn in the conversation, Bravura sits up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm listening.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (emotional) This isn't just some job stress freak- out. This is a man who lost everything, and who deserves a little understanding from the rest of us. If you'd known him before... (beat, pained) You'd want to believe him, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue
